A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. In other words, a number x is a quadratic residue modulo 9 if there exists an integer y such that x ≡ y^2 (mod 9).

We will find all quadratic residues modulo 9 by checking the squares of the integers from 0 to 8 (inclusive) modulo 9.

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 9)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 9)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 9)
3^2 ≡ 0 (mod 9)
4^2 ≡ 7 (mod 9)
5^2 ≡ 7 (mod 9)
6^2 ≡ 0 (mod 9)
7^2 ≡ 4 (mod 9)
8^2 ≡ 1 (mod 9)

From the above calculations, we can see that the quadratic residues modulo 9 are {0, 1, 4, 7}.
